message.content:
cs.DS, cs.SI, cs.IT, cs.NE, cs.GT 

This paper deals with the problem of determining the majority type in a network with local interactions and very small local memory. The problem involves designing population protocols that stabilize in the initial majority using only local interactions between vertices with very limited memory. This falls under the category of distributed computing and algorithms, which is covered by cs.DS. The paper also involves analyzing the performance of different protocols in arbitrary networks, which is related to the field of social networks and network analysis, covered by cs.SI. The paper also uses techniques from information theory (cs.IT), neural networks (cs.NE), and graph theory (cs.GT) to analyze the performance of the protocols.
